abstract: Smoothly ends a zoom transition in progress.
overview:
## Discussion

Calling this method is equivalent to calling [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/ramp(toVideoZoomFactor:withRate:)] with a rate of zero. If a zoom transition is in progress, the transition slows to a stop (instead of stopping abruptly).

Before calling this method, you must call [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/lockForConfiguration()] to acquire exclusive access to the device’s configuration properties. If you don’t, calling this method raises an exception. When you finish configuring the device, call [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/unlockForConfiguration()] to release the lock and allow other devices to configure the settings.

# cancelVideoZoomRamp()

**Instance Method**

Smoothly ends a zoom transition in progress.

## Declaration

```swift
func cancelVideoZoomRamp()
```

## Discussion

Calling this method is equivalent to calling [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/ramp(toVideoZoomFactor:withRate:)] with a rate of zero. If a zoom transition is in progress, the transition slows to a stop (instead of stopping abruptly).

Before calling this method, you must call [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/lockForConfiguration()] to acquire exclusive access to the device’s configuration properties. If you don’t, calling this method raises an exception. When you finish configuring the device, call [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/unlockForConfiguration()] to release the lock and allow other devices to configure the settings.

## Adjusting zoom

- **videoZoomFactor**: A value that controls the cropping and enlargement of images captured by the device.
- **ramp(toVideoZoomFactor:withRate:)**: Begins a smooth transition from the current zoom factor to another.
